data.title: Université de Fribourg
data.text:
Swiss Federal Rail Service (CFF)

The half-price season pass not only gives access to reduced prices for the Swiss Federal Rail Service, but also most private rail services, ferries, buses, and urban transport. In addition, persons under 25 with a «seven25» pass enjoy free 2nd class travel after 19h.

CFF

Public Transport in the Region of Fribourg (TPF)

Frimobil is the single travel pass for the Fribourg public transport network, which covers the canton of Fribourg and the Broye region of the canton of Vaud and is subdivided into 56 zones. Zone 10 encompasses the city of Fribourg as well as all of the University buildings. Single tickets can be purchased at vending machines at bus stops. Outlets for multiple-journey cards and passes are located at the counter in the bus station in Fribourg and various kiosks in the city and Fribourg conurbation. More detailed information on the travel network and the tariffs can be found on the web site below.

Transports publics fribourgeois (tpf)

Bus Station in Fribourg

+41 26 351 02 40

+41 26 351 03 93

tpf@tpf.ch

www.tpf.ch

Parking

Using this form, you can apply for a parking space (Miséricorde, Pérolles, Regina Mundi and Rue Techtermann), if you do not live in one of the following municipalities: Freiburg, Marly, Villars-sur-Glâne, Givisiez, Tafers, Corminboeuf, Granges-Paccot, Düdingen, Belfaux.

There is also a park and ride system within the urban agglomeration of Fribourg.

Mobility
